Description: Light green base fragment of a blown glass vessel, possibly from a cup, bowl or jug, pushed in tubular ring base.
Production place: Made in: Egypt (raw glass possibly imported from Levantine area)
Curator's comments: Chemical analysis (by electron probe micro-analysis (EPMA)) proves that the raw glass is compositionally close to the so-called Levantine I glass but with slightly elevated levels of manganese, a relatively uncommon raw glass group used in Late Roman/Byzantine Egypt. The raw glass itself might thus be an import from the Levantine area. However, this does not exclude that the vessel was worked in Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FE.14)
